pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.5: 45. The training rule on legal issues
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.2: a certain nun went to the nun Thullanandā and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.3: “Venerable, please come and resolve this legal issue.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.5: but then neither resolved it, nor made any effort to do so.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.6: That nun told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.10: agree to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolve it, nor make any effort to do so?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.18: agree to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolve it, nor make any effort to do so?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.19: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.20: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.21: ‘If a nun consents when asked by a nun to resolve a legal issue, but she then neither resolves it nor makes any effort to resolve it, then, if there was no obstruction, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.8: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues due to disputes, legal issues due to accusations, legal issues due to offenses, legal issues due to proceedings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.14: she does not resolve it herself.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.15: Nor makes any effort to resolve it:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.16: she does ask anyone else to resolve it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.17: If, thinking, “I’ll neither resolve it nor make any effort to resolve it,” then by the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.1: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as fully ordained, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.2: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not resolve the legal issue, nor does she make any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.5: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.3: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to settle it;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.8: The fifth training rule is finished.
